subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Basic newbie questions
author: Misty Dawn
full_text:
--0-1081504556-1197874069=:3566
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Hi Leslie. Welcome to the group.
   
  There are a variety of methods and tools one can use to record with. Many are outlined in past posts which are keyword searchable. Some are oulined in the links section on members pages etc. Ive outlined some of them on a website and in esnips
   
  http://www.esnips.com/user/MistyDawn
  http://misty.xm.com/
   
  As for the boxes, you can do the sweep tuning method using a regular am/fm radio with a knob/dial or you can try to obtain one that will sweep channels for you. Sumptions are all one of a kind creations, the current function is similar to linear sweep tuning whether done manually or automatically by Frank's box, the mini-box or RS Hack or <<insert name here>> versions. There are quite a few different experimental devices going on in this group and elsewhere. Lasers, optical recievers, micro doohickeys and thingamajigs that hurt my brain to try and understand LOL
   
  Good luck on your recording! While your at it why not throw in some ITC imagery and have some pictures to go with the voices 
   
  Misty
   
   
  Aquarius <laustin@...> wrote:
          Hi, all! 

I'm a newbie to this list, and very excited about what I've been reading the
last week or so.

Briefly, though I am a corporate consultant and exective coach by
profession, I've been a channel since 1971, working with one (wonderful)
guide. I've also done lots of psychic work over the years, had lots of
experiences, and consider the unseen world as "normal" and real as our
so-called ordinary world.

I have wanted for years to try recording voices of my unseen associates, and
am SO excited to begin to experiment, so I thank you all for the invaluable
information I'm reading on this list so far!

I have some very basic questions, and apologize if they are too simple or
repetitious for the more experienced and regular members of this list.

When some of you are mentioning that your mini-box is on the way, from where
are you buying it? What other systems are available, other than making one
with the Radio Shack radios (which I will experiment with for sure!).

Would it be possible to list the possible other equipment that one might
buy, and the sources? Or is this already available somewhere on the
yahoogroups website for this group?

Thanks in advance to one and all for any help you can give me with this...
there's SO much great info here it's a bit hard to sort out as a newbie on
the list who just dove in recently!

Cheers,

Leslie (in NYC)

"A hunch is creativity trying to tell you something."

-- Frank Capra, Film Director

"Honor your error as a hidden intention."

-- Brian Eno



                         



 



       
---------------------------------
